page.title: 08STUD FARMHOUSE,BLAISDON
page.content: Visit to Stud Farmhouse,Blaisdon. Mr. and Mrs Richard Hawker were interviewed on their{Stud Farmhouse which contains 73 hectares. Their main business is now a{dairy herd}and not a Stud Farm. They own 1{Hereford Cross {Bull and 120 cows} which they milk through Modern milking Parlours with computerised feeding. The cows are {British Fresian and British Holstein which are bred on the farm. Each cow produces{5,800 litres of milk}per year which is collected every day by tanker. From{1901-1924}the Stud Farm was famous for rearing{Shire horses. The farm employs a cowman and a student. The farm itself grows no crops except sillage (rotted grass) which is the main bulk food for the milking herd. Machinery wise they own 3 tractors and grass harvesting equipment.
